latestVersion.specialPermissions: Additional special permissions, where applicable, are described in the restrictions field.
latestVersion.restrictions: These data are released in accordance with the  provisions of the General Education Provisions Act (GEPA). GEPA  protects privacy by ensuring that respondents will never be  individually identified. Under Public Law 100-297, the National  Center for Educational Statistics is responsible for protecting the  confidentiality of individual respondents and is releasing these data  to be used for statistical purposes only. Record matching or  deductive disclosure by any user is prohibited. To ensure that the  confidentiality provisions contained in PL 100-297 have been fully  implemented, procedures for disclosure avoidance were used in  preparing the data in this release. Every effort has been made to  provide the maximum research information consistent with reasonable  confidentiality protections. Therefore, certain variables have been deleted and others have been recoded into broader categories.
latestVersion.conditions: AVAILABLE. This study is freely available to ICPSR member institutions.
latestVersion.disclaimer: The original collector of the data, ICPSR, 		and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility 		for use of the data or for interpretations or inferences 		based upon such uses.

fields.value: Schools and Staffing Survey, 1990-1991 [United States]: Teacher Follow-up Survey, 1991-1992, Revised Version

authorName.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection, a revised version of SCHOOLS AND  STAFFING SURVEY, 1990-1991 [UNITED STATES]: TEACHER FOLLOW-UP SURVEY,  1991-1992 (ICPSR 6317), is a follow-up to the Teacher Survey in  SCHOOLS AND STAFFING SURVEY, 1990-1991 [UNITED STATES]: REVISED  VERSION (ICPSR 2745). The Teacher Follow-Up Survey was designed to  update data on teacher career patterns and plans and to determine  attrition rates. It queried a subsample of teachers in the profession  during the school year 1990-1991 and had two components: teachers who  left the teaching profession between the school years 1990-1991 and  1991-1992 (former teachers) and teachers who remained in the  profession (current teachers). Information in this revised collection  is given separately for public school teachers (Part 1) and private  school teachers (Part 2). Questions were asked on topics such as  current activity, occupation, career patterns, educational pursuits,  future plans, attitudes toward the teaching profession, and overall  job satisfaction. Data are also available on teachers who remained in the teaching profession but moved to different schools (movers).

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File DOC2746.ALL.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.;Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File CB2746.ALL.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS and SPSS data definition statements;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) This revised version of the collection is derived  from the NCES's "Schools and Staffing Survey (SASS) and Teacher  Follow-Up Survey (TFS) CD-ROM: Public-Use Data for 3 Cycles of SASS and  TFS." This version contains additional created variables and  supersedes ICPSR 6317. (2) The codebook and technical manual are  provided as Portable Document Format (PDF) files. The PDF file format  was developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using  PDF reader software, such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on  how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided through the ICPSR Website on the Internet.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
